data.title: App not resume after press home button iOS 8.1.2 (black screen)
data.body:
I have posted this in robovm but this seem libgdx issue.

I use robovm 1.0 beta 1 and libgdx 1.5.0. After press home button my iPad Mini 2 iOS 8.1.2 it can not resume (press home button and then click app icon), it just show black screen. This not occur with robovm 1.0 alpha 4 and libgdx 1.4.1

data.title: Added new sub project for testing purposes
data.body:
Added a 5th sub project to gdx-setup called "tests". It includes a few sample tests and the GdxTestRunner.class. GdxTestRunner is required if your tests use libgdx environment. 

Run the tests with ./gradlew test

data.title: Event.stop() not stopping touchDragged
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.robovm.apple.coregraphics.CGRect.getSize() robovm
data.body:
I'm unable to build iOS with libgdx  / robovm. The application compiles ok, but im receiving this error during its startup:

> java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.robovm.apple.coregraphics.CGRect.getSize()Lorg/robovm/apple/coregraphics/CGSize;
>         at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSApplication.getBounds(IOSApplication.java)

>         at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSApplication$Delegate.didFinishLaunching(IOSApplication.java)
>         at  
> org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplicationDelegate$ObjCProxy.$cb$application$didFinishLaunchingWithOptions$(Unknown Source)
>         at org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication.main(Native Method)
>         at org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication.main(UIApplication.java)
>         at br.com.animvs.ants.ios.AntsIOS.main(AntsIOS.java)
### Versions:
- robovm: 1.0.0-beta-01
- iOS Simulator: 8.0
- libgdx: "1.5.1-SNAPSHOT" and "1.4.1"

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Crash when screen size hits 0
data.body:
Running a Macbook Pro, OSX Yosemite
While running, if the screen size ever hits 0, e.g.: 

![screen shot 2014-12-16 at 5 52 19 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6267043/5464335/891e650e-854c-11e4-8ed3-36fe9b6a9560.png)

the game crashes. 

Log is here: http://pastebin.com/v1FZ5C2d

I have not found a way to set a minimum screen size, or a way to prevent this from happening. Either of these would work. As it currently stands, I have to have code in resize to prevent it from getting that small. 

Sorry if this has been reported before, I did a quick search, and asked around on the IRC channel, and was told that there was no way to set a minimum screen size, nor did they know why this was happening.

data.title: Error loading pixmap: 8bit only
data.body:
After compressing PNG with PNGOUT, the file opens OK in virtually everything - with the sole exception of libGDX's `Gdx2DPixmap`, where it generates the above error in native call.

As far as I'm aware, libGDX supports formats other than 8-bit gfx... as such, the above error gives little to no information as to what's essentially wrong and, foremostly, why a valid PNG can't be loaded. I assume it's because the target image gets coverted to (valid) 2-color indexed PNG - still, why libGDX can't convert it to RGBA by palette lookup on-the-fly?

"good" PNG

![console](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9106762/5454507/d68312be-8532-11e4-8934-77154342f232.png)

"bad" PNG

![console_pngout](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9106762/5454505/ce82467a-8532-11e4-863c-320b583a904a.png)

data.title: Crash of ios app
data.body:
Hi:
I have use the libgdx1.5.0 to generate a default project and package it with Robovm Tools. when install done, I start the app , it can be start up,and the bad logic picture shows with red background, and do nothing, about 4 or 5 minutes, the app quit itself, I can not figure out why this happen, and there is no problem with the Simulator. Java: Java SE 8(1.8.0)
libgdx: 1.5.0
robovm: 1.0.0-beta

data.title: Bullet Strange comportment
data.body:
Hello everyone,
I found something very strange in the Bullet implementation of Libgdx.

If you have a constraint `btTypedConstraint`, and you want to get the rigid body inside that constraint, you can use `getRigidBodyA()` or `getRigidBodyB()`.

Theses methods return the `btRigidBody` by creating a new `btRigidBody` at the same pointer address (If I understand well).

``` java
public btRigidBody getRigidBodyA() {
    return new btRigidBody(DynamicsJNI.btTypedConstraint_getRigidBodyA__SWIG_0(swigCPtr, this), false);
}
```

The problem is that the original `btRigidBody` at this address loose some informations like `btRigidBody.setContactCallbackFlag(FLAG);`. Contact listener doesn't work after that.

It's very annoying because `getRigidBodyA` has a bad side effect and modify the original `btRigidBody`.
I know it's difficult because Java don't know the C objects but maybe there is a solution.

data.title: Android Fragment not well destroyed in particular case
data.body:
Here is the issue : 

We have a fragment with a gdx 3D viewer rendering. User tap the home button to display the "desktop" of the device.
Android can now decide to kill the activity if memory is required (you can simulate this setting Android debug options to keep no activities in background ). So if the option is checked, android destroy it.
Then the user displays all the running activities, and click on the gdx 3D viewer : the 3D view runs but the assets have issues (the 3D model is not renderend in my case)

With a little debug I saw that the dispose() have not been called, so the view is created again, but not well due to the missing dispose() call on leave...

I would like to manually reload all the textures on memory, such as the class AssetManager does automatically.

Is there a way that I could do this? I want to change graphics configuration. More specifically, I want to change the min and mag filter of the textures on the fly. And for that I need to reload them.

This could be considered an improvement if there is no other way of doing so?

Thank you in advance.

data.title: CpuSpriteBatch error: Can't invert a singular affine matrix
data.body:
CpuSpriteBatch should be very useful together with scene2d and transform=enabled. When several Groups on the scene have their ow transformations, the normal SpriteBatch will lead to many render calls. However simple replacement of SpriteBatch to CpuSpriteBatch often leads to error: Can't invert a singular affine matrix or to the loss of elements position precessions.

This happens when the first setTransform call happens when batch is not in the drawing state. If this first call occurs for for Group (for example) with setScale(0f), then the group will not be able to resetTransform  at the end of draw method with the error: Can't invert a singular affine matrix. This is clear because setScale(0f) will lead to singular matrix. If the same happens with very-very small scale, then position precision will be lost. The bad thing is that it is connected just with the first setTransform call, disregarding the hierarchy of the objects.

The proposal is to remove if (isDrawing()) checks in both setTransform methods of CpuSpriteBatch and always apply adjustAffine. If someone really need to set GPU transform, one can make couple of special public methods to set them with implicit batch flash (like SpriteBath does).
